author: Dreux
text: These people are a poor display of doing business. They will lie and steal your money if they have to. I purchased some shoes that were to small and since they told me I couldn’t return them I had to sale them. Well I posted them on Stockx the same exact day and they sold the same exact day. I shipped the shoes off on a Monday and they received them that Thursday. These people had the nerve to tell me that the shoes were worn. Not only were they never worn because they were to small but they still had the same green verification tag on them for when they sold them to me!! I even sent pictures to the first representative pleading my case for three days straight. She eventually stopped emailing me back which is pathetic. Then, here comes another representative that not only tell me that the shoes didn’t pass because they were “worn” but this guy also included that I sent them a size that I didn’t purchase!  These people are crooks and they don’t do their job properly. I will never do business with this company again. Once I experienced this with them I just had to google if this was common and to my surprise it actually was. So be careful with purchasing from these crooks.
title: Never Again

title: the shoes I ordered

author: Samantha J
text: This was my first, and most likely my last shopping experience with StockX.  I purchased a Telfar bag.  Received timely and thorough  status updates through  the authentication process.  Once at the authentication process - which was posted as “Passed” and in the process of packaging to prepare for shipping, it never shipped.  After contacting 4 customer service representatives, I was finally advised that the bag supposedly hadn’t passed authentication, and would not be shipped.  Disappointed.  The purchase was a birthday gift.  Luckily, I was able to purchase elsewhere and a refund was processed.
title: The 1st and last
